elements.text:
Your family members have some strong opinions and you don't always agree with them. One evening, you invite a friend over for dinner. 

Here are some behaviors that someone might do at that moment or in the future:

text: I zone out and stop paying attention to what people are saying.
I want to think of something else as everyone talks, but remind myself that I can handle my feelings and tune back into the conversation.
I want to change the topic so we can talk about something less serious, but I let go of trying to control the conversation.
I remind myself that everyone has different opinions.
I listen to my friend while they talk to my family members.
